did.abstract: John W. Henderson, professor of ophthalmology at the University of Michigan, arrived in Ann Arbor in 1942 as an intern and then resident before joining the faculty in 1948. He was chairman of the Department of Ophthalmology from 1968 to 1978. Hendersonâ€™s papers include files relating to his work with the Medical School and University Hospital, among them histories of ophthalmology at the university. Files detailing his work with professional organizations are well represented, notably the Michigan Ophthalmological Society, American Board of Ophthalmology, and American Ophthalmological Society. Also files relating to publications, lectures and presentations.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: The material was received from Dr. Henderson in 1982 and 2003 (Donor No. 6606).

accessrestrict.p: The material is open to research without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright status of this material is undetermined.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, John W. Henderson papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: John Woodworth Henderson was born in Clarinda, Iowa, in 1916. He received his bachelor degree from Occidental College in 1937, and his M.S. and M.D. degrees from Northwestern University in 1942. In 1948, he was awarded a Ph.D. by the University of Michigan. Henderson came to the University of Michigan in 1942, serving first as an intern. Subsequently he became a resident in ophthalmology from 1943 to 1948, a faculty member in the Medical School starting in 1948, and chairman of the Department of Ophthalmology during 1968-1978. A distinguished member of his profession, Henderson served in a number of national organizations, often in positions of great responsibility.

scopecontent.p: The John W. Henderson papers date from 1943 to 2001. The papers measure 7.75 linear feet and have been divided into four broad series: Medical School/University Hospital Records, Professional Organizations, Publications, Lectures and Professional Presentations, and Personal.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: American Academy of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology.
Association of University Professors of Ophthalmology.
controlaccess.subject: Eye.
Ophthalmology.
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. Dept. of Ophthalmology.

scopecontent.p: The Medical School/University Hospital Records (1969-1980; 2.0 linear feet), are arranged alphabetically by subject. They result mainly from Henderson's responsibilities as chairman of the Department of Ophthalmology. Of particular interest is a history of the department (see also the Publications, Lectures and Professional Presentations series) and early faculty member Flemming Carrow; medical staff meeting minutes (1971-1971; 1976-1980); material regarding the neural and behavioral sciences including review and search committee (1972-1975); and minutes of the University Hospital Director's Advisory Council (1975-1978).

did.unittitle: Biography (chapter 2 in The University of Michigan Department of Ophthalmology: A Proud Heritage)
Emergency Medical Services Review by joint Medical School-Hospital Task Force 1975
Medical Center Review Committee, Report to the President 1973
Report of the Coordinating Sub-Committee for Conceptual Review of Practices, Policies and Curriculum Teaching: A Careful Superficial Overview ("An All-Purpose Talk") 1961
Staff Survey (University Wide) Report of Results 1977
Greater Detroit Area Hospital Council Study (Blue Cross/Blue Shield Study) 1976-1978

scopecontent.p: Professional Organizations (1969-1981; 3.4 linear feet) represented in the collection include the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology, American Board of Ophthalmology, American Ophthalmological Society, Association of University Professors of Ophthalmology, Inc., Michigan Ophthalmological Society, and Michigan State Medical Society. Material is arranged alphabetically by the organization's name and chronologically within each organization.

did.unittitle: American Academy of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology (AAOO)
Articles of incorporation, by-laws, rules and regulations
Advisory Board for Medical Specialties, Inc. 1969-1970
Association of University Professors of Ophthalmology, Inc. (AUPO)

scopecontent.p: Publications, Lectures and Professional Presentations (1945-1980; 1.6 linear feet) is an alphabetically arranged file representing many of Henderson's scholarly activities. As subjects were often returned to after a lapse of time, and because much was undated, many folders dates are approximate. Of particular note is the manuscript and related correspondence on Henderson's history of the Department of Ophthalmology.

scopecontent.p: Personal material (1943-2001; 0.75 linear feet) further documents Henderson's career through curriculum vitae, information about his appointments, and two scrapbooks of clippings, programs and correspondence pertaining to his tenure and retirement.
